thread.title: How to get Rugby World Cup 2015 final tickets
thread.title_full: How to get Rugby World Cup 2015 final tickets - Telegraph

author: Telegraph Travel
title: How to get Rugby World Cup 2015 final tickets
text: Tickets for the 2015 Rugby World Cup are getting scarce. According to the official website, there is limited availability for 40 games and "moderate" availability for four matches, but the World Cup Final (as well as England's ties with Wales and Australia) is completely sold out. However, there are still options for anyone hoping to attend the biggest fixture of all, at Twickenham on October 31. Packages with England Rugby Travel (0844 788 5000; englandrugbytravel.com ), the official provider for the tournament, are available, including nine for the final. Among them is an exclusive package for Telegraph readers . It features dinner and drinks with former World Cup winner Will Greenwood, former international Austin Healey and the Telegraph’s chief rugby writer Mick Cleary; tickets to the game; private transfers; a tour of the museum at Twickenham; a two-night stay at the London Marriott Hotel Twickenham or the DoubleTree by Hilton London Westminster; and £100 to spend at www.rwcshop.com . Prices are £2,999 per person. There is a similar package too for England's tie with Wales . Watch the World Cup with Will Greenwood as part of an exclusive package for Telegraph readers Photo: GETTY Other options include: A " platinum package ", including tickets for the Bronze Final at the Olympic Stadium and the Final at Twickenham, with accommodation at the luxurious Langham hotel (£3,659pp). A two-night break including final tickets and accommodation at the Copthorne Tara Hotel in Kensington (£1,639pp). A two-night break including final tickets and accommodation at the Dorsett Hotel Shepherd's Bush (£1,519pp). For more advice on where to stay, and the best pubs to visit in each host city, see our complete Rugby World Cup travel guide . • Rugby World Cup: team guides • Rugby World Cup quiz • All the winners of the Rugby World Cup England and Wales are hosting this year's tournament Photo: GETTY Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
